section.title: What are system Actions?
section.p: Sometimes Agavi is unable to execute the requested Action: for instance, the user may not have necessary permissions, or the Action can't be found. In these cases, Agavi diverts execution and instead one of the system Actions is called.

A system Action is an Action with a predetermined purpose that is invoked by the framework when a certain condition occurs. System Actions are assigned in app/config/settings.xml. When you create a new Agavi project, some system Actions are precreated for you.

Agavi has the following system Actions:
"error_404" - called when the requested Action doesn't exist
"unavailable" - executed instead of all other actions when the "application unavailable" flag is set in the configuration. This is useful for maintenance etc.
"module_disabled" - executed instead of all Actions in a given Module, if that module is marked disabled in its configuration
"secure" - executed when an authenticated user doesn't have credentials necessary to access a secure Action
"login" - executed when an unauthenticated user requests a secure Action
